content: The following lists events that happened during **1970 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [Yusof Ishak](/wiki/Yusof_Ishak) (until 23 November), [Yeoh Ghim Seng](/wiki/Yeoh_Ghim_Seng) (Acting) (23 November to 2 January 1971) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### May - 2 May – The Queenstown Branch Library (now Queenstown Community Library) is opened to the public, making it Singapore's first branch library. - 14 May – The [National Junior College](/wiki/National_Junior_College) opens as Singapore's first junior college. 6 to 8 more junior colleges are announced over the next few years as part of a new education plan, along with more ASEAN students and scholarships, a new hostel in Outram by September and the St John's School to be run by a trust. ### July - 8 July – Singapore's first [kidney transplant](/wiki/Kidney_transplant) is performed on 29-year-old Doreen Tan at the Outram Park General Hospital (present day [Singapore General Hospital](/wiki/Singapore_General_Hospital)), led by Chan Kong Thoe. The operation is declared a success. ### August - 4 August – The [Ministry of Health](/wiki/Ministry_of_Health_(Singapore)) announced more hawker centres to be built within five years to resettle all street hawkers, resulting in greater hygiene and better facilities. For a start, three such hawker centres will be built this year. - 11 August The [Ministry of Interior and Defence](/wiki/Ministry_of_Interior_and_Defence) splits, forming the [Ministry of Defence](/wiki/Ministry_of_Defence_(Singapore)) and [Ministry of Home Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Home_Affairs_(Singapore)) to better cater for defence and homeland security functions. ### September - September - Singapore is admitted into the [Non-Aligned Movement](/wiki/Non-Aligned_Movement). ### October - 1 October – The first shopping mall in Singapore, the [People's Park Complex](/wiki/People%27s_Park_Complex), is opened. ### November - 23 November – Singapore's first [President](/wiki/President_of_the_Republic_of_Singapore) [Yusof Ishak](/wiki/Yusof_Ishak) dies while in office. [Speaker of Parliament](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore) [Yeoh Ghim Seng](/wiki/Yeoh_Ghim_Seng) temporarily serves as acting president during that time. ## Births - 22 June – [Glenn Ong](/wiki/Glenn_Ong) – radio DJ. - 22 August – [Gwee Li Sui](/wiki/Gwee_Li_Sui) – Poet, graphic artist, critic. - 31 August – [Baey Yam Keng](/wiki/Baey_Yam_Keng) – Politician. - 10 November – [Tay Ping Hui](/wiki/Tay_Ping_Hui) – Actor, director. - Dave Chua – Author of Gone Case. - Paul Tan – Poet, winner of 1993 and 1997 Singapore Literature Prize. ## Deaths - 23 November – [Yusof bin Ishak](/wiki/Yusof_Ishak), 1st [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore) (b. 1910).
